website_summaries.verdict: If you are brave, you will grow to like this keyboard style. Unfortunately, buying the stand and keypad can get expensive. However, in terms of pure quality, this device has it.
pros: When used with its adjustable stand, it becomes extremely customizable, making it very ergonomic
cons: The stand to elevate the keyboard and the side number pad are sold separately
Left hand quick access keys are hardcoded

website_summaries.verdict: A unique split-style keyboard that is well suited for on-the-go use. A small profile and light weight makes it extremely mobile.
pros: The split design allows you to position each half for the best angle with each hand
Built-in Windows compatibility with dedicated control keys
cons: Doesn't have the same curves and contours as other ergonomic options

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is okay, just not for me.
customer_reviews.text: There's a few things that bug me, first is the keyboard and the stand to give the keyboard the arch is an added accessory and an added cost; the second thing that bugs me is that the stand sometime collapse when typing. For example review the 5th picture I uploaded there are two height levels, on the second level can collapse while typing. I compared the Kinesis keyboard to the Microsoft Sculpt Ergonomic Keyboard for Business (5KV-00001), and I hate to say it but I end up choosing the Microsoft Sculpt Ergonomic Keyboard. I uploaded pictures of both.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Reduces Back Pain, Makes Typing Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my split keyboard. Most people don't realize how their shoulders are scrunched when using a standard keyboard, but when using the split keyboard, you can choose where it's most comfortable to put your arms, really giving your shoulders/shoulder blades a rest. I bought one for work (where I use a PC) and one for home (where I use a Mac) and both are great. I will never go back to using a "normal" keyboard; this thing is so much more comfortable. My co-workers think I'm weird, but they have no idea how much more comfortable it is!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna W.

customer_reviews.title: Great for shoulder issues
customer_reviews.text: I got this keyboard after injuring my rotator cuff. It allowed me to continue working with as little pain as possible. I don't like the lack of a number pad, but I got the separate number pad and it works well. My cat likes to lounge in the space between the keyboard halves, which is kind of adorable.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Pennell

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about the ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: I went with this because of the rating on Consumer Reports. I really do not see how it is any better or more comfortable as far as ergonomics go. It takes a few minutes to get used to the split keyboard but that is fine. It is definitely made well. I do not like a wired keyboard. I gave this a try anyway. My setup is using it with a laptop so me space is limited with my docking station and monitors. The usb cable is fine. It is the cable at the top that connects the 2 keyboards that takes up space.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Best split keyboard I've used so far.
customer_reviews.text: It's the only split keyboard I've ever used and liked. For a non mechanical keyboard the switches do feel quite good. My only complaints are that the non-standard keys are placed too tightly against the standard ones, so I bump them a lot. I struggle to locate the arrow keys without looking at them, which is hard for me as a person with many machines that I work on. (I'm not buying a kinesis for all of them). Sometimes I feel a little crazy as though keys are being pressed that I'm not touching. All I've ever wanted in a keyboard was a standard 104 key layout that was split in half. This is the closest I've seen to such.
customer_reviews.author: ao

customer_reviews.title: Stick with MS 4000
customer_reviews.text: Ordered with VIP3 attachment. Tried it out for 3 weeks. I really wanted this keyboard to work! I am going back to the Microsoft Natural 4000, here's why. The two rows of keys located on the left side cause me problems. I thought I could get used to them but as much as I tried, just couldn't do it. A minor hindrance for me was that the two halves of the keyboard move more than a one piece keyboard. The third minor dislike is the VIP3 attachment - one slight bump of the keyboard and the stand shifts, not very stable at all. I'll try again when the next version comes out!!
customer_reviews.author: Weave

customer_reviews.title: key malfunction
customer_reviews.text: I liked the split keyboard, as I could reposition it as I needed. I also liked the lights that indicated what function key I accidentally hit. HOWEVER, 5 months down the line, both the caps lock and the shift key suddenly reprogrammed themselves to cancel the window I was working in. After a day of fighting with it, I went back to a compact keyboard. The learning curve and illogical placement of the function switches caused a lot of typos. So the cons outweighed the good. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Alaska Hermit

customer_reviews.title: Great product for any keyboard jockey or programmer or ???
customer_reviews.text: I was starting to have back problems from using a normal keyboard. Doctor said I needed to try a split keyboard AND BOY ARE THEY EXPENSIVE. This was the most reasonable one for cost vs. features. It took about 3 days to get use to it but now there is no way I'd want to go back. My arms, wrists, & back feel much better now. I use my mouse between the two pads and that seems to work best for me. I do miss the number key pad a little with this set up but its worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST KEYBOARD EVER FOR HAND PAIN.
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A MUST HAVE FOR HAND PAIN. REASONABLE COST. I HAVE SMALL HANDS AND THIS KEYBOARD KEEPS MY HANDS STRAIGHT. YOU NEED GELPADS AND THE V3 ACCESSORY KIT. A GOOD CHAIR AND SIT/STAND DESK WILL ALSO HELP. GIVE IT A WEEK BEFORE YOU DECIDE IF YOU LIKE IT OR NOT BECAUSE IT TAKES SOME GETTING USED TO. NOW I AM TYPING AT MY PREVIOUS SPEED WITHOUT ANY DISCOMFORT. GET A TIMER AND STOP EVERY 30 MIN TO DO STRETCHES OR YOU WILL WIND UP WITH PAIN. THE HAND PAIN THING IS MANY LAYERED AND JUST THIS KEYBOARD WOULD NOT HAVE DONE THE TRICK WITHOUT ALL THE OTHER THINGS MENTIONED.
customer_reviews.author: Jenkintown family

customer_reviews.title: Huge help with minimal frustration
customer_reviews.text: Reduced my tendonitis. This keyboard allows a more natural position of the arms. The split also allows me to put paperwork in the middle, thereby eliminating the paperwork problem. With a single piece keyboard, my papers either sat in front of the keyboard, causing me to lean forward, or sat beyond the keyboard where they were harder to read. It took about twenty minutes to get accustomed to most of the keyboard's placement choices, but a few keys still frustrate me, albeit infrequently used keys. A relative told me about this keyboard, and I'm very glad he did!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: No more carpal tunnel pain!
customer_reviews.text: I have really bad carpal tunnel pain and this keyboard with the lifts and trackball have helped so much! I have not had pain in 2 weeks since I started using the set. Before, I had constant pain in both arms. I hope the quality stands up to longterm use. I will never go back to a regular keyboard if I can help it. I got the 20" center cord and I place the keyboard shoulder width apart and at a 10° lift. My typing speed has increased as well.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Buy me the mechanical version and you have this one. Otherwise you have to pry from my hands.
customer_reviews.text: Officially now only the second best keyboard ever. My daily typer. Kinesis now has a mechanical version which I'm not allowed to sell my firstborn to get. I would buy this keyboard over and over if I had to. I just wish I could buy one for work too. They aren't cheap but they soooo good. Learning curve is almost non existent. The ability to move the halves to suit your wrists reduces your risk of RSI to near nothing. Good for long winded typists and any day to day use.
customer_reviews.author: Mr O

customer_reviews.title: Good keys, good separation
customer_reviews.text: I was getting pain in my wrists and elbows. I purchased this through work to use with a Humanscale keyboard tray and mouse tray. The keyboard took several weeks to get used to but now it's as if I'd learned to type on it from the beginning. I had to separate the two units to get the right angle for my wrists. I also had to purchase a separate USB number pad. The keys feel like a regular keyboard - no fancy switches here (I wish they made one with Cherry Brown switches or some other mechanical option). Otherwise, this keyboard is pretty nice.
customer_reviews.author: M. Caruso

customer_reviews.title: I never post product reviews, but love this
customer_reviews.text: As far as ergonomic keyboards go, this was relatively inexpensive. Turns out it's a great product. Works great, seems like it's gonna last. Lets feel good. Good layout. I was afraid adjusting to the keyboard split was going to be difficult - and I can't speak for others - but the switch turned out to be easy. Being able to station my hands wide has made a tremendous difference for my neck and shoulder, which have been injured. For me, it's one of the best things I've chosen to do. I did buy it with the wrist supports and the attachments that allow you to adjust the angle og the sides to a variety of angles. I'd recommend that.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Douglas Tap

customer_reviews.title: Great for creating a more ergonomic workspace
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd time I have bought this keyboard. The first time work bought it for me. This one I bought for home. I am able put a small split between the two sides to keep my wrists in the more neutral line, without angling up like some many other ergonomic keyboards do. Also, without the keypad on the keyboard, I can move the mouse closer the the keyboard, which helps my right arm and wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just not worth the expense...
customer_reviews.text: Thought I'd go for the expensive model and would get a vastly superior benefit, but that's just not the case. This is okay, but you can get one that comes with a ergo mouse for less than half of this or "splurge" for the best rated one from Micro and it's still $20 cheaper than this one. Absolutely cannot justify the expense for this. Cool concept but way overpriced for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I love his keyboard! The full split has helped me be able to keep working very comfortably during recovery from shoulder surgery, but I will not go back to other keyboards later. The tilt options work well, and there is no bending my wrists at uncomfortable angles. The keys are quiet and nicely responsive to typing. There is nothing not to like about it!
customer_reviews.author: KissArmy

customer_reviews.title: Thinks I’m holding down a letter
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not worth the money. It would be great if it didnt constantly think I’m holding down a key. Very annoying because the keys aren’t physically sticking but it still keeps typing a letter and slowing down work because I constantly have to delete. It either thinks I'm holding down a letter, space bar, or backspace. This gets worse over time and happens now about every two words. I have had this keyboard for about 5 months. Don't buy this! Better options by better brands.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Oommen

customer_reviews.title: My second. They are the best
customer_reviews.text: ..and now a better price. I love the versatility of these. I bought one for work several years ago for much more - I was kind of nervous it wouldn't do the trick. Now I have one at home too. I like the longer cable so there are no constraints to how I position it, depending on how I am sitting at desk. It arrived on time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK, so I see now that the copy states ...
customer_reviews.text: OK, so I see now that the copy states the lifts are NOT included, but the photos imply it is part of the base product. You need to remove the sixth picture from this listing, or at least write sold separately on that image.
customer_reviews.author: ButterBean

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you have carpal tunnel in the shoulders or tense shoulders
customer_reviews.text: I was using the ergonomic keyboard because I have carpal tunnel in both my wrists and my shoulders but the ergonomic keyboard made the carpal tunnel in my shoulders are worse so I decided to spend the extra money and get this keyboard. This keyboard has been really great And I love that you can divide the keyboard and half up to 9 inches apart, which I do you have the keyboard roughly 4 inches apart and it has been a relief on my shoulders
customer_reviews.author: snymtns4

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard set (this plus the angled attachments plus the number pad)! The key pressure is perfect and the ergonomics are incredible. The only downside, I got the B key with my right hand. Now that it's on the left keyboard, I have to retrain myself, which is nothing compared to the ergonomics!!!
customer_reviews.author: Darren Z.

customer_reviews.title: Good at first, now some keys don't respond
customer_reviews.text: I liked this keyboard for the first few months, and appreciated the many ways it could be adjusted. Now, however, about 4 months into its use, some of the keys require a very hard touch or they won't respond. I am a fast typist, and having some of the keys not produce a letter when I hit them is causing many frustrating delays. I didn't spill anything into the keyboard, so there's no reason I can see for the keys not to respond like they did at first. It's very aggravating to only get a few months of good use out of such an expensive item.
customer_reviews.author: CRE

customer_reviews.title: very happy carpel tunnel relief
customer_reviews.text: HELPS MY CARPEL TUNNEL MORE THAN I CAN SAY!! I like the blue lights on the top right indicating caps lock, num lock and function. feels just like a regular keyboard to me except for the obvious! : ) I bought the VIP3 kit for this and that was well worth it. I didn't actually use the keyboard without that so it is hard to say how I'd like this otherwise, but it is a great combo for me!! don't be thrown off because it is two parts thinking you can't type that way. Give it a shot!! It isn't nearly as hard to adapt as you'd think.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little while to get used to, but has a very natural design infinitely adjustable to your needs. More substantial keyboard than theRmostat which felt cheap. A bit pricey with the options but has made typing much more comfortable for me. The copy and paste keys are well located and handy. Will not go back to a regular keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie H.

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard for most situations
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a half dozen or more Kinesis split keyboards, over the years. I am using a new one, right now. Used daily, they will wear out and require replacing every two or three years, especially if you spill stuff on them, like I do. But overall, Kenesis manufacturers the best ergonomic keyboards, and I especially like models with the split design. Microsoft also manufactures a couple keyboards with an awesome ergonomic design. But I dislike Microsoft keyboards, anyway, because they are manufactured with cheap, consumer-grade materials that are obviously not intended to last beyond warranty expiration.
customer_reviews.author: Apoiuwerhpga

customer_reviews.title: wire ripping apart
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard itself is very easy to accustom , improves wrist, shoulder comfort significantly with great price point. But wires are ripping off now with in an year... no so good.
customer_reviews.author: Jayakumar Rajagopal

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for repetitive stress ache in my wrist
customer_reviews.text: I'm a freelance writer and had chronic pain in my right wrist and elbow. One step I took was to reduce the time I spend holding my hands in an unnatural angle on my keyboard and mouse. This is my second Kinesis split keyboard (the 1st one lasted 7 years). In combination withand wrist exercises recommended by my doctor, it has solved my wrist and elbow problems.
customer_reviews.author: U. Shorr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my elbow issues
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for about 3 months now at work. I love this thing, it has helped out my elbow issues immensely. I like being able to change the amount of angle whenever I need to whatever is most comfortable. The extra keys are great too (copy, paste, etc.). I bought the VIP3 accessory kit for it as well which I’m glad I did. Very comfortable on the wrists. I am missing the number pad, but may buy that soon too, we’ll see.
customer_reviews.author: Corey M.

customer_reviews.title: Wrist pain is done.
customer_reviews.text: This has almost completely ended my wrist pain issues. The ability to position each hand independently allows me to prop up my left wrist with the keyboard at the perfect angle. I can easily type for four solid hours on this keyboard pain-free. If you have wrist pain, carpal tunnel, or just want the most adjustable keyboard on the planet, buy this. Absolutely get the accessory kit as well....should frankly not even be sold without it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy A. Vogel

customer_reviews.title: Good ergonomics, no n-key rollover
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Kinesis Freestyle2. I need it because I have terrible tendinitis that just won't quit. I'm a programmer that makes games, and often has to test them with keyboard controls. This keyboard lacks n-key rollover, so, for example, you can't press D, S, and spacebar at the same time, which is not an uncommon input for PC games. I was severely disappointed. Another small complaint, this keyboard also does not work over a USB to PS/2 adapter. But it's good for ergonomics, so it still gets 4 stars. Thank you for making this keyboard, please consider adding n-key rollover to all of your keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: You'll wonder how you ever used a regular keyboard before
customer_reviews.text: The split keyboard lets you hold your arms and shoulders in a normal position. I use this keyboard all day long and find it very comfortable. It doesn't take too long to get used to it. The shortcut keys, such as for copy, cut, paste, and undo are very useful.
customer_reviews.author: L. P. River

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: I spend a lot of time typing (12+ hours per day sometimes). So, I've tried a few different ergonomic keyboards. They are all better than a regular keyboard. But this one is AMAZING! I can move it to wherever feels most comfortable for my hands. It's not just ergonomic - it's personalized! Do yourself a favor and also get the accessory kit so you can tilt the keyboard. This is as comfortable as typing will EVER be.
customer_reviews.author: Sasafracas

customer_reviews.title: buy 20" and receive 9" instead
customer_reviews.text: Excited to try and realized the separation extension was way too short. I couldn't place it on the two sides of my cintiqu tablet. The box had two labels on it, Amazon labeled it wrongly with 20 inches. The keyboard model itself printed 9" on the back, as well as on the original manufacture label. The keyboard is also designed too high compared with mac keyboard, tilting angle won't help with my wrist with this height.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Esc is in wrong place
customer_reviews.text: If you want a split keyboard that allows to keep muscle memory compatible with laptops then this is not one of them. The main issue was that Esc key was in the wrong place, and there is bunch of useless keys under Esc. I kept hitting this keys by mistake until I gave up and returned this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey U

customer_reviews.title: Love it, easy to adjust to
customer_reviews.text: I have been suffering from elbow, wrist and thumb pain for about a year. I finally asked Ergo to come in and evaluate my work station. Long story short and several adjustments later, my department purchased this fantastic keyboard for me. LOVE IT. My pain is MUCH improved! Super easy to adjust to and VERY comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: For wrist pain is good
customer_reviews.text: I am a small person, this keyboard is big for my hands. But I could not find other smaller sized product, so I keep it. The good things is that I can turn the keyboard any angles I want so that my wrist pain is eliminated.
customer_reviews.author: Trixximum

customer_reviews.title: What wrist strain?
customer_reviews.text: I got the VIP3 accessory to go with this keyboard, and use that at the middle (10 degree) setting. It took a little time playing with the different angles and positioning to get the keyboard in just the right configuration, but with the placement freedom this keyboard gives you, the strain I'd feel in my wrists after a long day typing is gone. Most "natural" keyboards have an incline from the front edge to the back, which bends your wrists back, and creates strain. With this keyboard, there is no incline this way. My 1 wish for this is that the cord connecting the 2 halves would be RJ-45 plug-able instead of hard-wired.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W Blumreich III

customer_reviews.title: 2/3 heights work great
customer_reviews.text: Love the keyboard, the three different heights are good, except the 10 degree, my preferred height will collapse everytime, i fixed it by taping it, but its annoying b/c now i cant change heights as easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Smith

customer_reviews.title: I really like it. My only complaint
customer_reviews.text: I really like it. My only complaint, is that the keys seam to have a lot of travel. I wish the keys on this device were more like the Logitech K series, or usual laptop keys with a smaller amount of travel. Does take some getting used to, and I do miss the num pad a bit, but all and all I do like the posture. Will see how I feel after a week+ working with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P.

customer_reviews.title: Best ergonomic keyboard I've used!
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard! I've been suffering from shoulder pain for several months because of sitting hunched over a keyboard for 8 hours a day. With thi keyboard I can keep my shoulders back, and feel much more comfortable at the end of the day. I was worried it would take time to adjust to the keyboard being split and angled, but after just a few minutes of typing it felt perfectly natural! Definitely recommend getting the accessory kit to go along with it that provides the tilt wedges and palm rests.
customer_reviews.author: JoRo

customer_reviews.title: It saved me from surgery
customer_reviews.text: I was having painful carpal tunnel problems and this keyboard which I have both at work and at home has completely solved those problems. Also, see picture. The cat loves the split keyboard too.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A. Boike

customer_reviews.title: Do not use this keyboard if you intend to game
customer_reviews.text: Certain key combinations do not work on this keyboard for some reason, such as SD+Space bar, or DF+Space Bar. This makes it impossible to play video games where you want to use WASD+space bar at the same time. It's a shame such an expensive keyboard doesn't have the basic functionality that any $10 keyboard would.
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I wouldn't have to turn my arms in like a regular ergonomic keyboard and it has out very well. I can separate the halves far enough to keep my arms perpendicular to my shoulders so I don't hunch inward as I use to do.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepy Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great for touch typists who keyboard for hours per day.
customer_reviews.text: Despite the jokes from my coworkers about my "broken keyboard" I am happy not to have such painful wrists at the end of the day. PShould have gotten the model with the 20" cord though.
customer_reviews.author: J. B.

customer_reviews.title: I got looks at the office
customer_reviews.text: but who cares? my wrist pain went away almost immediately. if you require a wide-arm-typing-stance this is a great option. wish it had a numpad, but you can't have everything :T
customer_reviews.author: Max Davidson

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard has been great. I have been using it at least 6 ...
customer_reviews.text: I had starting developing CTS and decided to get more ergonomic. This keyboard has been great. I have been using it at least 6 months and still love it. I also purchased the accessory and can't imagine not have that. They wrist support and height adjuster is great. Since using this, I have experienced a lot less issues. My wrists and fingers no longer hurt throughout the day. I also really appreciate that I can have a decent space between the two parts of the keyboard. This allows my arms to rest in a much more comfortable position.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love it, got the 20" version and it's just long enough to make it so my arms sit at a neutral shoulder position. Keys are quite soft and quick to react, took a bit of getting used to but it's nice now. Layout takes a bit of getting used to but not bad once you find the escape key lol. I plan to cut the connecting cord between the two halves and solder in another 8 - 10 inches of wire in for a bit more flexibility and experimenting. Feels like being caption Kirk driving the Enterprise around. ^ _ ^
customer_reviews.author: John Capps

customer_reviews.title: I like my old Kinesis Maxim better
customer_reviews.text: This new version seems well built. I ended up returning it though because the space between where my fingers land on the keys and my belly is larger so less comfortable. The extra space is due to the (optional) wrist rests that a required if you want the keyboard angled up.
customer_reviews.author: Willard

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard with only one issue
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this keyboard is great. The flexibility of the split design allows me to type in a ergonomically correct position rather than my armrests, keyboard, and workspace forcing me into a bad one. Before the Freestyle2, I would often end work days with arm or wrist pain. No longer. The only issue I have with this keyboard is the position of the 6 key. It should be on the left, but is on the right. This is forcing me to relearn its placement after 20+ years of typing experience.
customer_reviews.author: SCMin80

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic keyboard if your wrists start to hurt
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic keyboard if your wrists start to hurt. I use it with Surface Pro 3 (docked), placing it in between the two parts. This is a wonderful set up and allows me to work comfortably and lean to the screen when/if necessary. I also rearrange the angles of the keyboard when necessary. The key travel is of a real keyboard, and the tactile feel is good. I'd give it 8/10. Adjustment to the split took about a day. It takes a while to get used to the key placement of special keys (but is so worth it).
customer_reviews.author: EugeneGTI

customer_reviews.title: Not Wireless!
customer_reviews.text: Beware, this is a WIRED keyboard. Who makes wired-only keyboards any more? It's 2020! I guess I should have looked better before buying it; now I have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D Malinowski

customer_reviews.title: A clear-headed, commonsense, down-to-earth, approach to a wide-spread problem
customer_reviews.text: The product was delivered to an address several blocks from me. I would not have known where it was or gotten it if the occupant of that address had not driven over and handed it to me. When I tried to contact amazon to warn them that there was a flaw in their system I found that to be almost impossible. (I spent hours trying to break thru the technological wall that amazon has built between itself and the public.)
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Alter

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Best ergonomic keyboard I've used. Simple design to just cut the keyboard in half but it allows for those small adjustments right to left. Would be really cool if they'd make a wireless version.
customer_reviews.author: Tall Reader

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice to type for not being a mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice to type for not being a mechanical keyboard. I'm knocking a star off here because the entire left side of the keyboard is god awful. I frequently find myself hitting the fn key at the bottom left which remaps the entire right side of the keyboard. Not great.
customer_reviews.author: Ashish

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I would expect a more solid feeling keyboard. The keys are not a pleasure to type on, they feel cheap and low quality. For a 15 to 20 dollar product it would be okay, but for over 100 dollars its crap.
customer_reviews.author: James Canada

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you add the VIP3, not ergonomic without
customer_reviews.text: I failed to realize that the keyboard does not ship with the VIP3 attachment that allows you to angle the keyboard. That is my fault, but it makes the ergonomics of the keyboard terrible without. They should not have included a photo of it in the description. I just ended up purchasing that VIP3 attachment as well and will leave an updated review after. The price is getting absurd and this keyboard is not ergonomic without the VIP3, not sure why it is not included.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: This is the best natural way of typing
customer_reviews.text: This is the best natural way of typing. My arms are out straight from my sides, naturally. We were taught to type on a small typewriter and got used to it. I type while in meditation, with my eyes closed and this keyboard is perfect. I live in a rain forest and I assume that is the reason that I am on my second keyboard in three years. Still I will keep on getting it reguardless of how long it lasts. I also love the supports that can lift the boards at a slight slant that is comfortable and natural as well.
customer_reviews.author: Hallelujah Jai

customer_reviews.title: My second Kinestis keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Kinesis keyboard that was a Christmas present several years ago. My youngest brother is an ergonomic engineer, and he recommended this keyboard to reduce wrist stress while typing. The original keyboard has insert as a normal function key. I deducted a star on this keyboard is you have to have the blue function mode on to access the Insert key. Most inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Crash and Burn

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Quality-Built
customer_reviews.text: Solid, Well-Built, Quality item. Still have not gotten used to the placement of giant delete (not backspace) key, or the placement of the Fn key, but overall a great product. Was plug-and-play, no problems. I use it with the Ascent Mini-Tower. Would like a channel to manage the cord between halves. Suitable for heavy use. Would like additional tactile guides on keys -- not always sure whether I'm reaching the 5 or 6. Those are minor issues on a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jon-Jay Tilsen

customer_reviews.title: The keys have a great feel but the "compact" keyboard setup lacking a number ...
customer_reviews.text: The keys have a great feel but the "compact" keyboard setup lacking a number pad, rearranged home key area and 2 columns of useless keys on the left leave so much room for improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Z

customer_reviews.title: Great for shoulders and chest, terrible for hands.
customer_reviews.text: The split is a great idea, and it really helped my hunched shoulders and tight chest muscles. The wider setup allows your shoulders to rest in a neutral state as opposed to a forward-reaching or internally-rotated state. However, they keyboard is so small and cramped that it's causing inflammation in my fingers. My hands are in a constant "claw" shape, and after about a month of use it has really started to hurt. I won't be using the keyboard any more. Unfortunately, there's a 30 day return policy on the keyboard and it took just over 30 days to realize how painful this keyboard will become.
customer_reviews.author: Paige S

customer_reviews.title: Great action and feel to the keys
customer_reviews.text: Great action and feel to the keys, pieces hold nicely to the desk surface without shifting as you type. Took about a week to get both sides set exactly where they feel best for speed/accuracy and to get my full typing speed back. Your mind has to adjust to understanding that two pieces still work as one when using Shift ect if you look down while doing so. If it matters to you , i'd suggest holding them in place with tape or marking their placement in case they are moved. I need to know when I return to my work area the keyboard is just where it was in order to get quickly back to work.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara e

customer_reviews.title: The keys felt wobbly
customer_reviews.text: Surprised about the feel of the keys. They were too deep to type fast. I had to press down too far and they were bit wobbly to me. Only one like this in the price range, so was hoping for a fit.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard ever
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboard ever. The extra long dividing cable is worth springing for. Plenty of room between them on the desk for things like forms/papers/lunch/whathaveyou. A definite improvement over the Freestyle 1, too - better key placement, and they remembered the printscreen key this time!
customer_reviews.author: Justin H. Legate

customer_reviews.title: Great for touch typists!
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing what this keyboard will do for your shoulders. After over 20 years in the software industry, I've found a keyboard that works great for me. I did end up also getting the kit to tilt the keyboard and provide wrist rests; I highly recommend those too, if you like having your keyboard tilted.
customer_reviews.author: C. Vonludwig

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for everyday.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is really awesome. I use it at work and it is very comfortable. Positive: It is very comfortable, much more than regular keybords. Negative: 1. To make it so comfortable you really need to buy also "VIP3 Accessory Kit for Kinesis Freestyle2" which as for me is too expensive for few peaces of plastic. 2. One stupidity in the layout: to press insert which is often used by me, you need: first to press additional key, then insert, additional key again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The split design is good, and i like the copy / paste keys
customer_reviews.text: The split design is good, and i like the copy / paste keys, but i am annoyed copy is not on the right. It does make the mouse far away which has its own issues for the wrist. The deal breaker for me is that the keys are old fashioned and springy. Lots of people talked about the keys being low pressure, and I envisioned the microsoft sculpt keyboard's typing. Not like that at all. They spring back which hurts my hands and I'll be sending back. Wish I could get the sculpt except flat rather than angled.
customer_reviews.author: Kagulire F.

customer_reviews.title: Probably saved my job.
customer_reviews.text: I went from savage wrist pain after 4 hours of typing to typing 11 hours a day no sweat with this keyboard. Killer. I wish they would maybe put braille on the keys because sometimes my hands lose track of where they are on the keyboard, other than that awesome. I've also tried the Microsoft ergonomic keyboard; it requires too much force per strike and as such was no help to me.
customer_reviews.author: N. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard, bizarre key locations
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this 4 stars because it's the best in its kind. But there's definitely a lot of room for improvement. Some key locations are downright bizarre (the so-called combo/special ones, such as copy, paste, etc). Quite a few times I've pressed one of those buttons and my monitor display switched from horizontal to vertical. The keyboard definitely needs the VIP3 accessory that comes as an overpriced add on, but then again that's not perfect either. (Why it doesn't come with the keyboard, considering the keyboard itself is pricey enough, only implies that it's a money making scheme.) Like I said, it's the best in it's class, but that's because everything else in its class is so crappy.
customer_reviews.author: niz

customer_reviews.title: NOT what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this is more a review for the service than the keyboard. I ordered this keyboard, and have received a Freestyle Edge gaming keyboard. I have mobility problems with my wrists, and I need that keyboard to work, now have to go through returning the darn thing and waiting to get what I actually ordered delivered. Really, really frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Buzadzhi

customer_reviews.title: Shoulder surgery keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for post-shoulder surgery and simply peopped one side up to keep my hand in a more neutral position. This allowed me to go back to work sooner (saving my time off for better things than recovery). I'm mostly recovered and have dropped it down and still love it! Highly recommend the 10-key if you're used to it!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Peters

customer_reviews.title: Splurging on a keyboard that works best with accessory equipment that drive the total cost well ...
customer_reviews.text: *Waiting to get resolution regarding failed column of keys. Issue: Splurging on a keyboard that works best with accessory equipment that drive the total cost well over $130 is extremely frustrating if the 1, q, a, z, alt keys are non-responsive. Hoping to provide an update shortly after hearing back from the seller. I do not expect hardware to be without bugs, but to have keys fail within < 75 days of use is not encouraging. Hoping for a replacement or refund despite being just outside of the return window. Will update upon resolution...
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: What a way to type
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard feels so good. Took no time at all to get used to it. My wrists are in much better position now
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Comfort But One MAJOR Problem
customer_reviews.text: I'm able to space the keyboard apart to a comfortable position for me. I love the Cut, Copy and Paste keys located to the left. It provides the comfort I need. Unfortunately, occasionally, the R, T, F, G, C & V keys would stop typing and I've only had it 5 months total. I need to purchase another keyboard, but perhaps a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Bambi g

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I really like the responsiveness of this keyboard it is almost like the letter shows up before I even press the key. The ability to tilt the two sides of the keyboard independently of each other is very nice as well. The only con is that some of the keys are slightly different from where they are placed than other keyboards. That will just take some time to get used to, however, I really like the way this keyboard types.
customer_reviews.author: David Carter

customer_reviews.title: It works well for maintaining a good open chested posture
customer_reviews.text: I read about these elsewhere, and got it to help with my shoulders. It works well for maintaining a good open chested posture. One thing some might worry about is the getting used to it aspect - you need to be more of a touch typist because you don't want to be bringing your left hand over to the right side of the keyboard. Took me about a month, now I''m fine and its absolutely worth it. And a side benefit - it has cut, copy, paste and del keys at the left hand - I'd love to have those on all my keyboards now, including the laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Not for Linux users or developers
customer_reviews.text: The problem I had with this keyboard is the bad placement of the keys to the left of the keyboard. If I attempted to tab and missed, the Web home key was the that was hit and on more than one occasion I had a web browser load when hit. Also the Web Back and Web Forward keys are nearby and I had the misfortune of accidentally hitting those while working on filling out a web form. Had to start over more than once. Otherwise, it works as it said but I find that it would take some getting used to and a lot of hair pulling before you do. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Good split keyboard but awkward layout
customer_reviews.text: Good product, no doubt. The accessory kit should be included but anyway. The real bummer is the awkward keyboard layout. I strongly prefer the standard IBM layout still widely used so I have no idea what the designers were thinking here. Yes, you get used to it but honestly it needs improvement in a future generation.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: This is a great device. My only issue is I like even ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device. My only issue is I like even simpler, remove the left 2 columns of keys. The other issue, It should cost less (I feel this way about all ergonomic hardware.)
customer_reviews.author: F. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Favorite ergo keyboard
customer_reviews.text: My favorite ergonomic keyboard. I love that you can change the angle and position based on your different work stations or posture.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy it. Taking some getting used to but overall ...
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using for a week. I really enjoy it. Taking some getting used to but overall im so much more comfortable. I have no idea wht split keyboards arent more popular. My only negative- i am left handed and all the shortcut keys are on the left side of the keyboard. But i can definitely work around it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebeccah

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Got it when my arm was in a cast. Worked well. Needs a dedicated insert key
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two years and Carpal GONE
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing. Not only can you angle both sides to be more natural, you can raise both at the middle. I haven't had any carpal symptoms since using this. It looks crazy and people not familiar with it will roll their eyes? It's very, very good. Order it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Garza

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard...
customer_reviews.text: I was suffering from shoulder issues... I am a Java developer and a weight lifter and my shoulders where getting really cranky i assumed it was from the weight lifting but it turned out to be me using a conventional keyboard... Having very broad shoulders forces you to round them when typing, using the Kinesis i can space my keyboard out and type with less rounding of the shoulders... This is not a knock on the keyboard but its almost useless without the addons that allow you to tilt it up... the keyboard itself sits flat on your desk without it and that is painful to type on...
customer_reviews.author: Huggy77

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I am digging this keyboard way more than my old microsoft split keyboard. It's less finger pressure to type (although not as light as the apple keyboards that I've used) and the fact that you can customize the separation and angle is huge plus. Only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because there isn't a calculator keyboard area that I'm used to. I'm sure I'll get over this in time but once you have a feature you come to rely on it's always a downer when you lose it.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and easy to use.,
customer_reviews.text: Well designed, takes a little bit of practice to get used to ist but easier on the wrists.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mathewson

customer_reviews.title: ... in a sling (shoulder surgery) and couldn't be more happy. Go with the longer connection cord
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this so I could work with one arm in a sling (shoulder surgery) and couldn't be more happy. Go with the longer connection cord, because even that isn't really that long, but don't hesitate to get this keyboard, you won't be disappointed as long as you plan on using it with your hands spread apart (take note that there will be a gap in the keys even when you put each side together)
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin W Crane

customer_reviews.title: Great Find, Glad I tried it out.
customer_reviews.text: I use this with the 10 Keypad, I work between two offices so pack this up in a Thick Canvas Brief Case to transport it. I also go the accessory parts for it. I don't use the foam covers. Shoulder and arm pain has greatly reduced. Works well with the Evolution Vertical Mouse. I do CAD work, so programed the F8 key into the mouse. Really like the height adjustment of the accessory kit. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Kline

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great ergonomic keyboard. Comfortable, great quality and makes typing all day much easier. Everyone should have one of these if they are typing for 8 plus hours a day. Only issue so far is the L key doesn't seem to work as well but otherwise perfect! Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A friend of mine recommended this keyboard and the roller mouse
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine recommended this keyboard and the roller mouse. It was very difficult to learn the keyboard with the roller mouse I purchase. It took up less room on the desktop but the keys are so different than the Logitech. I have two of them and would prefer to sell them if anyone is interested. Nice key board but not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard can be made even better
customer_reviews.text: At 6'3" I really like finally having my hands separated at a comfortable distance rather than scrunched up arms trying to type on a tiny keyboard. The VIP kit is a necessity for me to put the hands in a more natural and supported position though.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Adamski

customer_reviews.title: I don't like that I would have to pay extra for feet ...
customer_reviews.text: Some of the buttons are positioned in weird places in the layout of the keyboard. I don't like that I would have to pay extra for feet to change the angle of the keyboard. I do like that this keyboard allows me to keep my wrists more straight, which was my primary concern. It seems to have relieved some strain on my wrists. I like the keys. They clack just enough to be satisfying (I wouldn't recommend this keyboard if you want your typing to be quiet), and are springy enough to give good tactile feedback.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a transcriptionist, so keyboard comfort is extremely important in my life. This keyboard has been a real game changer for me. My shoulders and elbows are much happier now that I can control the distance apart. So dreamy!
customer_reviews.author: VCook

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I love this keyboard. I transcribe Pathology reports all day and am amazed at the ease and comfort at which I can relax and type without my shoulders up around my neck or my chest getting in the way. I don't feel like my chest is resting on my arms as I type. I wish I would have found it 30 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Deneen

customer_reviews.title: much better than a flat keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It works as expected...much better than a flat keyboard. There was a loose key, and I called the company's tech support but they didn't do anything other than speculate as to what the problem might be. They said they would send me something to fix it, but didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: good as gold
customer_reviews.text: i love the split keyboard, and have been using one for years. this one has some nice improvements, in touch and placement/spacing. if you need to keep your hands apart, arms straight, and /or shoulders steady, this is the keyboard for you!
customer_reviews.author: happy camper

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these. One for work and one for home, and one spare because I spilled milk on one and thought it broke (it works again though). AWESOME keyboard. Thanks to the engineers of it. This solved my carpal tunnel issues.
customer_reviews.author: Reader10928

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t stay positioned in order to use. The clips fall apart all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Kats

customer_reviews.title: ... some of my wrist pain but by no means perfect. and have had to make a number of ...
customer_reviews.text: it has helped with some of my wrist pain but by no means perfect.and have had to make a number of changes to my desktop setup in addition to the new keyboard...there a few major issues for me that would be great enhancements and the reason for my average rating: 1. available in wireless would be great as the cables are extremely annoying. 2. I don't know why they had to move keys around ...it is easy to make typos and i have to redo my work 3. for some reason i have to reset the fn key often otherwise, my keys stop typing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Kinesis Freestyle2 Ergonomic Keyboard for PC (9" or 20" Separation) (9" Separation)
feature_bullets: AWARD-WINNING SPLIT DESIGN: Unlike fixed ergonomic keyboards, the Freestyle2 allows you to rotate and separate the key modules up to 9" to achieve natural hand, wrist and forearm positions for your specific body type and preferences.

STANDARD WINDOWS LAYOUT: The Freestyle2 for PC features a standard Windows layout with hotkeys like Cut, Copy, Paste, multimedia keys, and an embedded numeric 10-key to boost your productivity. No software or special drivers required.
LOW-FORCE KEY SWITCHES: The Freestyle2 uses a custom membrane key switch that features a low-activation force and tactile feedback to reduce finger fatigue, impact and strain.
WHAT'S IN THE BOX: Freestyle2 USB Wired keyboard with a standard Windows Layout, detachable pivot tether for adjustable splay, and Quick Start Guide. Plug-and-Play for Windows 7-10.
PLUG-AND-PLAY: Windows 7-10, Linux, and Chrome. No software or special drivers required.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars462 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
